values: I have been feeling really out of the loop recently.  Partially because when I work overnights I have next to no time at home, barely enough to sleep, shower, and grab some food.  But I think there's more to it than that.  Just a nagging feeling.  And the not-so-great thing is that I no longer care as much.  Soon I may not care at all.  It bugs me that I don't have enough time for my horse and my husband, but as for the rest, oh well.  I am content to bury myself in my work and my own solitary life.  With my new project, I feel like some sacrifices will be required, but if it means missing out on some things, oh well - it will be oh-so-worth-it in the long run.  5 years from now life will be amazing.  So for now, as long as I can hold on to enough horse time to keep my spirit nourished, and enough snuggles with J, the rest can all take care of itself.  Sigh.  I hate feeling this way, but at the same time I feel like I should stop fighting it, stop trying to make everything fit, and just surrender and go with the flow.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/95664.html

Today I have so far managed to book a Drs appointment and a dentist appointment, and send out a bunch of resumes.  One interview so far.  Yay!  I don't want to leave North Town all together but I do feel that is is time to broaden my horizon, see what else is out there, or at least go through the process of putting together a resume/CV and sending out applications and going on interviews.  So let's see how employable I am...  I waffle back and forth between "I am an awesome vet, I have worked 3 years in emerg so what clinic wouldn't want me?" to "I have been out of school for 3 years, I hate surgery and am afraid of spays, what clinic would want me?".  It really is quite amusing.

Ok, now it is time to go organise some books.  We got 3 new bookcases last night for the office and discovered we have room for one more, so we will have a total of 8 in the office.  Yay, I am so happy.  I want my hallway and spare room and living room back!

EDIT:  Ok, I feel pretty good about myself.  I sent out 5 resumes last night and I have 2 interviews already!

EDIT #2: Ok, so now within 2 days of sending 5 resumes I have 4 interviews - and clinic #5 (the one that hasn't responded) is not hiring, I just know the Dr in charge so I sent in a resume for next time they are looking.  Whee!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/95253.html

I think I may be about to run out of neurons.  My brain just feels so full.  I don't know how much more I can multitask!  And everything is important, so it's not like I can remove something from my life.  It's all about balance, I guess.

- Whisper keeps my heart and soul alive
- the gym keeps my body healthy
- snuggling my cats keeps my blood pressure down
- Jason - well, you can't live without love, can you?
- the Grove and other such things keeps me spiritually fulfilled
- North Town (my life as a vet) keeps my mind active, gives me my daily dose of puppy and kitten therapy, gives my life meaning, and is as necessary to me as breathing
- sleep!  I need lots and lots of sleep!
- healthy food, cooking, eating - these things are not optional
- my mother - a necessary annoyance, a great source of stress, but really I am glad she is here
- my house - I need to keep it clean and tidy (or at least somewhat) or else I start twitching in a most unhealthy way - I am seriously thinking of taking a week off just to clean - hey, I have the vacation pay, so why not?
- reading - escapist literature - gives my brain a break from my real life!
- CE - I need to keep learning new things, or else I will stagnate and rot

And on top of all this I now have this wonderful new and exciting project, stimulating and scary all at once, which I just cannot wait to share with everyone!  I'm hoping to be able to spill the beans in about 2 months, but until then you'll just have to put up with the occasional veiled references from me.  

In other news, so far it looks like the election is going well, we have a liberal premier and local liberal representation, which makes me very happy.  However I'm a little surprised by the MMP results.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/94753.html

Grrr.  I am tired.  I have too much to do and not enough time.  My house looks like a hurricane hit.  And my mom, who was supposed to have 2 or 3 boxes of my stuff from her house in texas, has about 12 - all sitting in my living room.  I'm afraid to open them because of the crap she may have decided was mine, and now I have to get rid of it.  I need to do laundry, I have no clothes.  And grr grrr grrr.  Oh yeah, and I have that other project to work on.  I am so tired.

Ok, end of rant.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/94465.html

Hi everyone!

Busy busy life has been insane, but over the last few days I have seen a million cute puppies and kitties - more than usual.  I love puppies and kittens.  And I got to see a guinea pig today, which is always fun.  I have tomorrow off, but the day is already crazily overbooked.  First and foremost, I must sleep.  I am so tired.  Then I am going out with Sonia to look at a certain place.  Then I want to go see horsie and then we're going to my mom's for a thanksgiving dinner of pizza and storebought pie - we have all been way too busy to even think about cooking!  Oh yeah, and somewhere in there I need to do laundry, clean the house, and we want to work on the office floors at last.  Whee!

Happy thinksgiving, everyone :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/94251.html

Life has just been too busy lately.  Here's the recap:

Saturday we got home really late, dropped off mom's cat at the clinic to board, and came home to collapse, exhausted from 3 days of driving.

Sunday we had Grove stuff, which was awesome.

Monday I had a meeting to go to, I helped my mom with some settling-in stuff, and I worked midnight to 8am.

Tuesday I got home in the morning and napped, then did some errands and went to see my horsie in the evening.  My mom is upset because I won't let her go out to see him without me there, but I just don't trust her with him - she will get hurt, he will get hurt, someone will get hurt, and whenever a person gets hurt around a horse, the horse gets blamed, even if the preson was blatantly at fault, so I will not have that.  My horse is awesome, but you need to know how to act around horses or else accidents will happen.

Wednesday I worked.

Today my mom's furniture was supposed to arrive.  We went to customs, no problem.  Then we arrive at the apartment building and they say that the moving truck is too big so the driver has to scramble to find a smaller truck and reload everything so we won't have her furniture until tomorrow.  So no I have a little bit of down time.

Tomorrow, saturday, and sunday, I work.

Maybe on monday we can get back to instgalling the floors in our office...

So that's my life.  My house is a mess but I don't care right now, I am going to relax if it kills me :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/94187.html
I'm home, I'm home, I'm home, I'm home, hooray!  I hate the United States, I love Canada, I am never leaving again.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/93931.html

So we left this morning, 1 day and 2 hours later than planned (we were supposed to leave wednesday no later than 7 am, we left thursday at 9am) but at long last we left Laredo!  There was much rejoicing.  Despite one on-and-off whining cat, one 3-hour stall in traffic due to a moron truck driver who drove into a brigde (yup, only in texas!) and several bathroom and coffee breaks, we still made decent progress - hooray!  Tomorrow I hope I can get my mom in the car by 7 am, because I don't love the idea of driving more than 12 hours in one day, but hey, approximately 1/3 of the trip is done.  I can not wait to see the Canadian border, although I always love my country, it is only when I am away that I realise how much I truly love and appreciate Canada.  Ok, now it is time for pizza and then bed.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/93567.html

Or maybe a flu.  Either way, I have a fever, I alternate between chills and sweating, I am drained of all energy, I have a massive headache and sinus pain, I am nauseous and fighting to make myself eat because I know I won't get better without enough nutrients, coughing and sneezing and fun snot coming from my nosem I am generally miserable and exhausted.  I broke down and took some meds and I still feel like crap.  And we are supposed to start driving tomorrow morning.  And my mother, the queen of procrastination, still has tons to do before we leave.  Ain't life grand!

Ok, end of whine.  I'm going back to the tylenol bottle and then I'm hgaving my 3rd or 4th nap of the day.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/93394.html

In about 6 hours I am leaving for Texas, for what will hopefully be the last time - ever!  Mom and I are driving up, which should be... fun...  She is currently driving me crazy over the phone, I'm hoping that once we actually start driving she'll relax a bit.  Either way, it is worth it to finally have her leave Texas.  Yay!  So I will most likely be off email and so on until friday.  Updates will follow.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/92953.html

1) My mom has decided to adopt the cat who was surrendered to the clinic because she was broken and her owners couldn't afford to fix her.  I fixed her and found her a home.  Yay!  She's very sweet most of the time, but she has a streak of crazy, so I hope she settles in well.

2) I hate the new hotmail.  Hate it.  I think I may have to switch to GMail.  I have had the same email address for about 8 years now, but this new hotmail thing sucks sucks sucks.

3) The radio is playing lots of Rush tonight - I am happy.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/92829.html

Last night there was no painting.  We were supposed to work on the office when Jason got home, since we really really REALLY want to get it done.  But, instead, we sat down and watched Grey's Anatomy.  We never watch TV because we don't have cable and our schedules don't allow for regular viewing, so we wait until we get it on DVD.  Hence, we have only seen season 1 so far (no spoilers, please!).  So last night, we watched the last episode in season 1 (for the 2nd time for Jason and 3rd time for me) and then, instead of getting up to paint, we proceeded straight into season 2, which we had just bought recently.  Woo hoo!  I am so excited!  I finally get to watch season 2!  It was a struggle going to bed after just one episode, I really wanted to watch all night!

And today I must drag myself to work, where we will of course be understaffed and overbooked.  Grrr.

On the happy side, my mom's movers are there right now, picking up her stuff.  And I got the keys to her apartment yesterday.  She is really moving.  Although I won't really believe it until we have driven across the border.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/92584.html

Something out of the blue just happened, something wild and crazy that has totally made my day.  I can't give details as it is totally early stages and confidential and I still need to process it.  But... HUGE vote of confidence from my old boss, a vet whom I totally respect and admire.  And, a potential for something amazing to happen.  It may be one of those opportunities that the universe puts in your path, which totally changes your life, takes you places you never thought you would go.  EEEEEEEE!!!

Either way, I will let you all know when I can, for nowI just wanted to share my giddy crazy happy glow!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/92226.html

I am fighting a yucky cold.  So I feel like crap.  But, so far, I also feel productive.  Yay!  Of course, I only got up a few hours ago, but hey, that's my schedule.  So far I have done laundry.  I plan on being productive today! Clean house, do dishes, run errands, go to gym, work on assignment, cook, and get my mom a phone line.  Bets on how much I will actually get done?  Sometimes I wish I had staff, a team of minions, or maybe clones, so I could delegate and get 10 times more done each day.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/92117.html

So, back in july the farrier told me that Whisper's feet were a bit bruised, because the ground had been so hard and dry, and he thought I should put shoes on.  Ok, no problem, my attitude has always been "what my boy needs, he gets" - so on went the shoes.  And he promptly threw one, so it was replaced.  So far so good.  Now I find an email from Doreen (the lady who rides him and spoils him for me when my schedule doesn't allow - long story, awesome lady, cancer survivor, cute little dog...) anyways she emails me that last night she went out and once again, no shoe.  So the farrier will be there tomorrow I hope to fix the situation.  I was hoping to ride tonight.  I love just visiting, so I will still go out tonight, but I really was hoping to get to ride.  Grr.  Oh well, such is life with horses :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/91817.html
Woo Hoo!  Sora has officially landed, she is on Ontario, and will be at Oona's tomorrow for potluck-y yumminess!  Yay!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/91615.html

My bed is calling me... so loud... it is saying "I am so soft and warm and cozy... come spend a few more hours with me..>".  It even stole my socks in an attempt to keep me there.  But, I managed to ignore the warm soft coziness, get up, and pull out the ingredients for brownies.  So, I am baking for or get-together this afternoon.  Then I will stop at Timmy's on my way to the barn, pick up a hot caffeinated sugary cup of goodness, and go watch horsies.  Yay!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/91148.html

So today I am going to Danielle's wedding - woo hoo!  Should be a beautiful event, outdoor ceremony, tent reception, Masquerade Ball theme.  Unfortunately it is a bit chilly outside, and the sun keeps coming out and then hiding, but I don't think it's calling for rain at least.  Yay weddings, I am a total geek, I love them.

Tomorrow I am going to watch a clinic at my barn, I'm in no way up to riding in it since I don't like to jump and Whisper is still learning to canter (he will canter... but it's fast and uncoordinated and unpredictable - we're working on it) but I'm really looking forward to watching, learning a bit, and just getting involved in the horsey atmosphere.  I've been pretty much a recluce at the barn, but I feel like I want to get to know people a bit more and be more than just a random person who flits in and out on occasion :)  Plus, I can't think of a more fun way to spend an afternoon than watching pretty horsies.

And that's about it for me.  I have a few days off, which will be consumed with finishing the office, cleaning the house, and getting some stuff set up for my mom's new place.  Then the next week I go to Texas and we drive up.  Yikes. 3 days in a car with my mom, I don't know... but hopefully (and I'm almost afraid to say this for fear of jinxing it) but hopefully it will be the last time that I go to the US for a long long time, other than for vacations and conferences and such.  Have I mentioned how much I hate the US these days?
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/90886.html

I sure hope so, because I feel like I am slowly being beaten down by 3 separate areas in my life.  Sometimes they take turns ("ok, you whack her now, and while she's still reeling I'll pop in and shake her up") and other times they gang up on my all at once.  You know, any one of these things I could manage with reasonable calmness, but when it's everything all at once...

1) Grove issues.  Enough said.

2) My mom's move.  Stress!  I have to make a million phone calls and errands and get things set, fly to Texas, drive back with her... On my current to-do list we have: phone, internet, cell phone, cable, re-schedule elevator for move-in day, calm her million-and-one panic attacks, deal with her cat who is 16 and antisocial and in no condition to handle this move gracefully, get a triptick from CAA and plot the route for the drive, call my Dr and see if he is taking more patients since she will need a referral to a cardiologist ASAP, call my dentist and see if he is taking more patients, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something...

3) Work.  Not only is the schedule in its usual state of chaos but now, I have to unexpectedly take 3 days off at the end of the month thanks to #2 above.  Now, normally it is the Dr's responsibility to cover their shifts once the schedule is posted, fair enough, but I think this falls under the heading of "family emergency" or at least "family situation" (did I mention that my mom is in her mid 60's, in poor health, and I am her only living relative? and that she is moving from Texas?) so silly me, I assumed they would be understanding and helpful, considering how very flexible I have been in the past and the fact that I have never before had to leave unexpectedly (I've been there 3 years) and that at least they are getting advance notice on this... But no.  They are giving me grief.

Did I mention that I'm about to explode?

Ok, enough whining and feeling sorry for myself. At least I have:

1) A Grove with whom I can have issues... so many pagans are solitary and have no community at all.
2) A mom who is alive and moving closer to me so I will no longer have to put my life on hold to travel to texas several times each year.
3) A clinic where I usually love working and usually love most of the people. 

I'm not sure I should post this, but they say that rants can be therapeutic:)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/90733.html

Oh dear.  My to-do list is insanely long, I really should get some of these things done, but all I really want to do is lie on the couch and watch TV.  I have re-discovered my "Scrubs" addiction.  I loved the show but haven't watched in ages.  I bought season one, I got Jason hooked, so I can't watch until he gets home.  Boo hoo!  SO once the caffeine works its way into my system I may try to be productive, at least for a little while...
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/90507.html
Have you ever tried a frozen timbit?  YUM!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/90300.html

I survived this stretch of overnights!  After surgery on 3 nights in a row, too many deaths, too many stupid owners, and too many stupid vets, I finally got a break last night.  The cardiac dog survived until morning, there was only 1 walk-in, and I actually got to sleep for an hour!  And now I don't have to go back until friday night, hooray!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/89886.html

So once again work is consuming every second of my life for the next 4 days.  This morning I stayed late to help another Dr with a surgery - he was all alone because we are short staffed, and this 130 pound, mature, fat mastiff came in for a spay (I can hear all the vet-type folk cringing and wincing).  So, lots of fun surgery, took forever, dog did great.  I am so tired.  

My mom's stuff is coming together, we have a date for the meeting so I can finally book a plane ticket.  But, as fate would have it, it is not when they told us it would be originally, so the time I took off work doesn't fit and the time when I need to go is when I am working, so I need to do some major re-shuffling.  Oh well, at least I will be here for Danielle's wedding (which I absolutely refuse to miss) and I will also be here for Sora's much-anticipated visit.

Other than that, life is blah.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/89731.html

Oh yeah, and here's one more thing I wanted to share at the Retreat, but since the Bardic never happened I didn't get the chance.  

So, since the Christians often ask themselves "WWJD?" (What would Jesus do?) when faced with a dilemma, I wanted to see what we as Spiric Pagans would come up with:

WWAD? (Apollo) - Test their musical skill, in a fair and logical contest.

WWAD? (Artemis) - Turn them into a stag to be ripped to shreds by their own barking hounds.

WWGD? (Gaia) - Remind them to worship the ground they walk on.

WWSD? (Selene) - Moon them, of course.

WWDD?  (Dionysus) - Get drunk, and "rise" to the occasion!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/89596.html

Ok, my internal clock is messed up again.  I was supposed to sleep until 10 or 11, since I work until midnight tonight and am on overnights on thursday... but at 8:30 am I was wide awake!  And I did not get to bed early last night, so definitely not enough sleep.

So, I am awake, I fed the cats, I checked email etc, and now my coffee is ready so it is time for me to try being productive and work on my totem assignment.  Problem is, there's just so much to say that it may never be done!  Thank goodness I can submit everything electronically, otherwise I would be cutting down a small forest to provide enough paper...

Oh yeah, and the office is now officially empty of junk, shleves, wall brackets, carpet, and floor tacks.  It is ready to wash and paint!  I can't wait until it is done.  And when we move everything back in, we will do a major tidy/organise/purge, because we have way too much crap.  One room at a time, and in a few years, this house will look great.  Unless we move first...
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/89212.html

Retreat was good, weather cooperated except that one time... 10 adults, 2 little ones, 1 tarp, 1 huge downpour.  Lots of yummy marshmallows and veggie hot dogs and other good food.  2 good rituals.  Lots of wasps but amazingly no one was stung.  

We are in full renovating mode again, the office id almost empty and the rest of the house is in chaos.  Computer on the kitchen table...

I got an email from a friend I hadn't heard from in years, so good to know she is ok.

Ok, must go be productive before going to snuggle horsie.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/88995.html

I just turned on my favourite classic rock station - you know, real classic rock, heavy on the guitar and the social commentary, light on the sugar coating.  So anyways, there was some sort of gospel guy on, discussing the bible... WTF??  So I promptly switched stations...
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/88826.html

I do not like camping.  I do not like all the planning and organising that is required.  Planning meals that will keep me from being hungry, that can be cooked on a campfire or better yet eaten cold, can be packed into a cooler and will not go bad if our crappy cooler doesn't work.  Packing a tent, bedding, clothes, bug gear, etc, into the car, then carrying it from the car through the woods and setting it up.  Dealing with contact lenses when there are no bathroom facilities nearby.  Oh yeah, and dealing with rain and nasty weather.  And then, getting to unpack it all and clean up when we get home.  Too much effort required, what part of this is supposed to be fun?  Next year, I want the retreat to be at an all inclusive resort, preferably in the carribean on the beach.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/88378.html

I have now been awake for 26 hours.  And I randomly found an old boyfriend on facebook - the guy who broke up with me AFTER proposing to another girl, and then wouldn't speak to me or look me in the eye for years.  So I sent him a "hi", let's see if he answers... hee hee :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/88114.html

We have been planning to renovate... planning... talking about it... thinking about it... and finally we are doing the office.  So we moved almost everything out today, and tomorrow we will rip up carpets, soon we will paint (bye-bye hideous train trim!) and then put new floors in.  Very very excited.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/88050.html

Yup my life is boring :)  But at least last night we actually had time to sit down for a little bit.  It has been crazy. Not much is going on... just apartment stuff for my mom, mainly.  I have to find the time to get things set for the camping trip, since we haven't used our tent in a few years.  And we're thinkin gof doing the next renovation project, new floors and paint for the office.  I wish I had the ability to just wave my hand, or blink, or something, and have the whole house redone all at once.  We have so much junk in the office I don't know what we'll do with all of it while we're painting.  Should be fun.  Ok, that was a random ramble, I think I'm tired, time for bed :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/87642.html

Woo hoo!  I found something to share at the Bardic!  

Now I just need to figure out what I can make to feed a horde of ravenous pagans and families, that is easy to transport, requires minimal preparation, is veggie-friendly, dairy-free, and yummy to all taste buds...

Yup, it's 7:30 am, I have been up all night puttering, and now it's almost bed time since I work tonight.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/87459.html
I finished the last book this morning - it was amazing!  So so so so good.  What else is there to say?  This is a series I will definitely re-read in a few years.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/87083.html

So I found my mom an apartment, the rent is higher than I hoped and there's no laundry in the apartment itself, just the building, but other than that it's really nice - secure, clean, bright and sunny, has AC, includes all utilities, underground parking, and is close to my house.  So I'm filling out the application today - keep your fingers crossed!  I'm applying for it myself because that will be simpler than getting her name on the lease, with her currently in Texas and not moving until move-in day.  So I hope it goes smoothly, but since I already have a mortgage I don't know if I'll be a pproved or not... we'll see...

In other news, I am exhausted, fighting a cold, and stressed.  Everything feels up in the air, and being the kind of person I am, I don't like chaos and uncertainty, so I normally respond by cleaning and organising anything I can get my hands on, unfortunately I don't have the energy for that, so I sit on the couch and stew over all the things I should be doing.  

Thankfully I have a great book to read - I am halfway through the final Harry Potter book - and very sad that it will soon be over!  Although I got a copy of Handmaid's Tale at last, and will soon be able to start that, hooray!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/86945.html

Not entirely true, I just can't sleep normally.  
<lj-cut text="another sleepless ramble"> 
I worked overnight on saturday - and what a night!  Understaffed and absolutely insane.  I won't bore you with details, but it included a cut paw that needed stitches, a kitten who got stepped on, a puppy who was so hypoglycemic I'm amazed he was still alive, a gazillion walkins, and a ful hospital.  Fun fun.  And the previous 3 nights were pretty much the same.  So, needless to say, no breaks or naps for me.  So on sunday morning I come home, exhausted but way too wired to sleep.  I stay up until 10:30 am and go to bed - sleep deeply and well, and wake up at 7pm because Jason is poking me.  It's our only day off together for so so long, so we wanted to actually spend some time together.  Anyways, sunday night I go to bed at 2pm and wake up at 4:30 am, can't sleep, toss and turn, get up to read for a while, go back to bed at 9am and then sleep until 7pm again.  Last night I go to bed at 2am and again woke up at 4:30am.  The problem is, I need to actually be up during the day today!  I need to get groceries, an oil change on my car, check out apartments for my mom, go see my horse (I am about to go into a horse-deprivation-induced seizure), and maybe even go to the gym.  And, of course, I work overnights again on thursday.  What can I say, I am a mess! </lj-cut>

In other news, I bought a furminator for the cats - really awesome!  We are getting so much fur off them, I am excited.  Hopefully soon the number of hairball vomits, and the fur-bunnies hiding in the corners, will go down noticeably.

I am now done HP book 4 and have started 5.  Hoping it will be a better read this time.  And looking forward to 6 and 7!!!

Hmmm, what else...  

Not much, my life is pretty boring these days!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/86583.html

I am now done book 3 of Harry Potter.  Yay!  With work being so short staffed, it's been hard to get enough reading time in.  I am so looking forward to book 6 (which I only read once, and loved) and of course book 7!!!!!!!


My silly horse lost a shoe, so I can't ride until the farrier gets out to the barn to fix it.  So today I just brushed him and fed him carrots and took him out for grass.  Very relaxing.

I have been staying on an overnight schedule, so last night/this morning I went to bed as the sun rose, and slept until I was done sleeping - no alarm clock - it was glorious!!  Now I work again wednesday night, I hope we have a kennel staff, I am tired of being under-staffed.  2 people should not have to do the work of 3.

My mother has officially, finally, really-and-truly closed her practice.  I am so happy, this means she will finally be moving back to Canada!  Of course, all the stress of finding her a place to live will fall on me, and then I will have to go down and drive up with her most likely, and apparently her car cannot pull a small U-Haul so I don't know what we will do...  But I'm sure it will sort itself out.

Spiritually I have been in a total slump recently, no time or energy or even interest for much, but I think I may be coming out of that.  It happens periodically, so no big deal.

And I think that's all, folks!  It's 5am, so I will go eat dinner, read a book for a while, and toddle on to bed.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/86463.html

I have it, I have it in my possession, I got my grubby little paws on it, I have the last Harry Potter book, hooray!  Now if the silly emergencies would stop walking through the door... my plan is to read from the very beginning, books 1 through 7, in one continous flow of HP-orgy.  Thank you, to the wonderful person who picked it up for me :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/86131.html

Another night with no kennel staff.  Usually there's 3 people in the hospital overnight, today it was just me and the tech, and it was her first overnight shift.  Fun.  Overall it didn't go too badly... Now I am so tired I just want to go home and sleep and sleep and sleep.  I got a one hour nap last night, which was wonderful and refreshing, but now my bed is calling me.  So as soon as the morning Dr gets here and I transfer everything to her, I am out of here :)
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/85717.html

A much needed and longed-for quiet night... busy appointments but then almost empty hospital, and no calls or emergencies between 2:30 and 6 am.  We go upstairs, put in a movie, and settle in for a nap.  But I can't sleep!  I toss and turn, watch the whole movie, watch the moon and the stars through the window, listen to the birds sing their morning song, get up and lurk on some facebook discussion boards, and watched the sunrise.  I want to sleep!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/85319.html

My life may not be glamorous, but at least it's never boring.  

Last night:
- annual exam with a very cute little dog who likes to eat diapers and tampons and other such goodies
- behaviour consult with a dog with huge separation anxiety who ripped some teeth out on her crate
- 15 year old kitty with a bladder infection
- cat with trouble breathing - cool x-rays - removed 300ml of fluid from her chest - breathing much better now
- dog with anal gland issues
- dog having allergic reaction to the shampoo the groomer used after getting a REALLY BAD haircut
- puppy with kennel cough (2 month old, ball of fluff, soooooo cute!)
- ferrett with torn nail bleeding all over the place - that will teach you to try to open the pantry door!
- dog with ginormous abscess - so satisfying to pop and drain!
- dog who ripped his sutures open from a lump removal on his back - I love local anaesthesia, he was in and out and resutured in under 30 minutes
- DOA (dead on arrival) very old boxer

And that's just what came in the door, not what was already in the hopital!  Now, I want to sleep.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/85172.html

So J's car decided to die this weekend - overheated or something?  Which meant that I had to drive him to work on saturday (not really a big deal) and today (more of a big deal).  Today I start another stretch of overnights.  But instead of sleeping in and then relaxing until it was time to leave for work, I got to wake up early (ok, for most people 3pm is not early, but it is when you wor 8pm-8am!) to drive him to work.  Then I came home. Then I will go to work, he will drive my car home for the night, and come get me in the morning.  But, at least his car is fixable - expensive, but not exorbitant, and not a total write off.  Because I don't think we can afford a new car right now, and with my schedule, being a 1-car family just doesn't work!

I also bought the book for the book club - very excited to start that!  And I booked my emissions test, so once that is done I need to renew my license plate and then that's all done for 1 more year.  And I mailed in my house insurance.  So, productive over all.
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/84758.html

Not enough time...

Yesterday I got home from work in the morning and went straight to bed.  Woke up around 5 I think.  Went to the barn to visit my horse.  Came home, long phone call with my mom, ordered pizza, and watched TV and read "Animal Speak" until 3am.  

Today Jason's car is broken, so I had to wake up to take him to work.  Now I have a few hours of putter time, then I will go riding and pick him up on my way home.  Of course, it's Canada Day, so our street will be closed from 9 to midnight.  And what time is Jason done work?  9, of course!  Grrr.

Tomorrow I will hopefully drag myslf to the gym before ritual.  I haven't been to the gym in almost a week, which really sucks.

My latest fantasy has been about moving.  Away.  Out of Brampton.  To somewhere that the neighbours aren't crammed in like sardines, where I can't hear every workd they say and all the yelling at each other, their kids, their dog... I have come so close to yelling at them to shut up!  I want to move, I really do, but with Jason still not sure about school... and all the stress with my mom... and of course finances... I don't know if it's even worth thinking about... but there's a house about 45 minutes away that costs less than my current house, and is nicer in every way...
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/84718.html
So a puppy licks a frog and is having an allergic reaction.  Why would you lick a frog???  At least we don't have any of the truly toxic frogs up here...  I hope...
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/84303.html

Sigh.  I am working way too much this summer.  4 days in a row doesn't seem like much, but it is when those 4 days are 12 hour overnights that usually end up being at least 13 hours.  Leave home at 7:30pm, lucky to be home by 9am.  Doesn't leave much time for a life.  I sometimes manage to go to the gym in the morning after an overnight, but not always/often.  And I definitely never make it to the barn on days that I work night shifts.  Just doesn't happen.  Which means I see my horsie once or twice a week, if everything else in under control.  Fortunately a very nice lady at the barn has been riding him, they seem to be connecting well, so a bit of my guilt is relieved, but still... 

Sometimes I just want to work 2 nights each week, or 3 days...  But, then I couldn't afford my horse or my house or any of those other necessities.  I love my job, but I also love my horse and my husband, going to the gym, veging and watching TV and reading...

What I really need is 30 hour days, so I can sleep 12 hours, work 12 hours, and still have 6 hours to myself.  That would work well for me!
http://rhia-rosamund.livejournal.com/84147.html

Algonquin was incredible.  I want to live there.  In fact, if it weren't for J's school, I think we'd be moving up somewhere in that area next spring.  I am so so tired of living in the city, I just can't stand it much longer.  I need open spaces, trees, lakes, wildlife, open sky, clean air, privacy, no neighbours, no traffic noises, no stupid crime...  Sigh.  A part of me is happy that we had such a wonderful vacation, and a part of me is depressed because I don't like where we are in our life right now.  Grr.  And of course all of this, in addition to some wicked PMS, is causing me to stress majorly over the disaster that is our house, and making me fantasize about ordering a very large pizza and watching TV all night.

In less than 24 hours we will be at a luxurious resort in Algonquin, for 3 entire days and nights of wonderful fun and relaxation - yay yay yay yahoo yay!

But first, I have a mile long to-do list that I must complete before bed tonight.  I think I am about halfway there.

Yesterday was exhausting, it's just part of the routine at North Town to get stuck there late, but when an 11-hour day turns into 12 1/2, it's draining.  Today I got out a smidge early, which was great, so I managed to go to the gym for a quick workout. Then I washed the dishes, which had been piling up for days, made lunch for tomorrow, made banana bread, had a shower, and checked email.  I have a kazillion things on facebook to reply to that I just never get to, I have bills to pay and projects to work on and people to email and oh boy I don't think I'm doing any more of it tonight, or at least not right now.  I need dinner and a nice relaxing book.  2 more days of work, and then it's off for our anniversary vacation, woo hoo!  3 days of wilderness during the day and luxury at night, I can't wait.

I just realised how long it has been since I last posted.  So, to all those friends of mine out there - I am still here, still alive, and still reading everyone's journal.  Nothing much is going on in my life.  

- Work is the usual insanity.
- Our computer died so I have no access to all the things I was working on, I HATE working off the laptop but am glad we at least have it so I can get online.
- I am way behind on a certain assignment and grateful to my patient sponsor.
- I am excited about sunday.
- My mother's life is in complete chaos, causing me to be constantly in a state of worry for her and incredibly drained after talking to her on the phone.
- My horse is, as always, wonderful, and today is his birthday.
- The cats are full of craziness.
- The guinea pigs are finally sharing a cage without attempting to kill each other.

And that, my dear and faithful readers, is my life!
